summary: The Cosmetic Hazardous Ingredient Right to Know Act of 2025 amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to increase transparency regarding cosmetic ingredients. The bill mandates website disclosure of all cosmetic ingredients, including fragrance and flavor ingredients, and provides links to lists of hazardous ingredients. It also requires ingredient labeling on cosmetic packaging and establishes a master list of concerning chemicals. The bill defines key terms like 'brand owner,' 'ingredient,' and 'professional use', and sets deadlines for compliance.
